org.gearvrf

Class GVRSurfaceViewRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRSurfaceViewRenderer

  • public class GVRSurfaceViewRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
    Create a descendant of this class if you need to do complex GL state management. Most applications can do all their initialization in GVRScript.onInit(GVRContext). If you need explicit access to the EGLConfig, or the difference between Renderer#onSurfaceCreated(GL10, EGLConfig) and Renderer#onSurfaceChanged(GL10, int, int) really matters to you, declare a class which extends GVRSurfaceViewRenderer and pass an instance to GVRActivity#setScript(GVRScript, String, GVRSurfaceViewRenderer) .

      • onDrawFrame

        public void onDrawFrame(GL10 gl)
        Generally, you should not override this. Your GVRScript.onStep() method will be called every frame, and GVRF provides mechanisms to dynamically add and subtract per-frame callbacks. You can install 'one-shot' callbacks and you can add and remove recurring callbacks.
